name: hyperbolically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If someone writes or speaks hyperbolically, they do it in a way that that makes someone or something sound bigger, better, or more important than they are: The government hyperbolically claimed that the new broadband network would transform our lives. They described the festival, hyperbolically, as "the largest global event ever". Related words
hyperbolic
hyperbole
More examplesFewer examplesWe often hyperbolically state that we are "starving" when a mealtime draws near.People sometimes talk hyperbolically of a performance moving them to tears, but at the end of this concert, I actually cried.
